title: Should you buy shares in London Stock Exchange Group?
description: LSEG’s market stumble comes as Anthropic launches artificial intelligence tools that could compete with its core data services
content:
LSEG’s own market stumble is particularly painful because it announced in October that it would be selling its data to Anthropic to help train in its Claude platform, the chatbot that has now wiped about £4 billion off the blue-chip’s market value.

title: At Sarasota’s New College, DeSantis calls for AI regulation
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis spoke at New College of Florida on Wednesday to push for state-level regulation of artificial intelligence.
content: Gov. Ron DeSantis has signaled that Florida is willing to step into the breach in the battle for artificial intelligence regulation, amid inaction by the federal government. During a panel discussion at Sarasota’s New College of Florida on Wednesday ... [2725 chars]

title: AI anxiety batters software execs, costing them $62B: report
description: Some of the wealthiest software executives in the US have reportedly lost a combined $62 billion this year as fears grow that artificial intelligence could gut the industry’s most profitable businesses.

title: Software stocks are selling off, but this big name may be worth another look, charts show
description: Software stocks have been suffering as fears of disruption from artificial intelligence rattle the industry, but one name is testing an uptrend line.
content: Software stocks have been in the headlines lately for all the wrong reasons — namely the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) . Of course, IGV is driven by its holdings, and its largest component is a name we know well: Microsoft (MSFT) . ... [3168 chars]

title: XAI OpenAI IP Theft Suit Hangs in Balance in California Court
description: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence venture xAI urged a California federal judge Tuesday to reconsider her tentative decision to dismiss its lawsuit accusing OpenAI of orchestrating a worker exodus to siphon off trade secrets. At a tense hearing, xAI’s counsel argued that while individual allegations against former employees may appear fragmented, taken together they form a XAI OpenAI IP Theft Suit faces dismissal as judge questions trade secret claims.
